description:
Arm Holdings reorganized into three main business divisions in early 2026: (1) Cloud and AI, (2) Edge (mobile devices and PC products), and (3) Physical AI — a newly created unit focused on robotics that incorporates the existing automotive business. Drew Henry heads the Physical AI division.

The creation of a dedicated Physical AI division is structurally significant: it separates robotics/physical world AI applications from the cloud/digital AI stack, reflecting a bet that embodied AI will become a distinct market requiring specialized architectural decisions. Plans to add dedicated robotics staff signal this is a real structural commitment, not just a rebranding exercise.

The three-division structure maps roughly to time horizons: Cloud and AI (current revenue from data center), Edge (current revenue from mobile), and Physical AI (future revenue from robotics). This is a clean structural separation of exploitation (Cloud, Edge) from exploration (Physical AI).
